snippet: When investigators showed Pedro Hernandez an image of Etan Patz, who had said he had killed, he looked away, but later wrote a confession on it, an official said.
abstract: New York City Police say that Pedro Hernandez wrote a short confession of the 1979 murder on a photograph of Etan Patz during questioning on May 23; written confession could prove to be important to the trial, as the prosecution is likely to lack physical evidence in the decades-old case.

byline.contributor: Russ Buettner and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: When investigators showed Pedro Hernandez an image of Etan Patz, who had said he had killed, he looked away, but later wrote a confession on it, an official said.

headline.seo: Patz Suspect Said to Write Short Confession on Boy’s Picture
headline.main: In Patz Case, a Confession on an Image of the Child
headline.print_headline: Patz Suspect Is Said to Have Written Confession on a Picture of the Boy
